sidebar.useDirectoryTree: Use the directory tree on the left to switch between rallies
sidebar.noTrackletIds: No tracklet IDs found in annotations

eventAnnotation.title: Event Annotation
eventAnnotation.selectEventType: Select Event Type (Click or Use Hotkey)
eventAnnotation.modeActive: mode active. Click any bounding box to assign this event.
eventAnnotation.selectFirst: Select an event above, then click a bounding box to assign it.
eventAnnotation.hotkeyTip: Press QWERTY keys (Q,W,E,R,T,Y,U,I,N) for quick event selection

idAnalysis.title: ID Analysis
idAnalysis.noAnalysis: No analysis available. Click 'Analyze IDs' to check for issues.
idAnalysis.noIssues: No issues detected! All tracklets look good.
idAnalysis.help: This tool detects missing frames, ID switching, and color inconsistencies by analyzing bounding box regions in images.

annotationDetails.title: Tracklet Information
annotationDetails.teamPositioningInfo: Home team is on the right side of the net, Away team is on the left side of the net
annotationDetails.clickEditToModify: Click "Edit Information" to modify annotation information
annotationDetails.selectBoxToEdit: Select a bounding box to edit its information
annotationDetails.selectTrackletToEdit: Select a tracklet ID to edit its information

navigation.title: üéØ Navigation & Controls
navigation.jumpFrame: Click timeline to jump to specific frames
navigation.zoom: Mouse wheel - Zoom in/out (Press 0 to reset to 100%)
navigation.pan: Right-click + drag or Middle-click + drag to pan around image

drawing.title: ‚úèÔ∏è Player Annotation Modes
drawing.selectId: 1. Select tracklet ID (1-98) from grid above
drawing.drawingMode: 2. Press D or click 'Draw New Bounding Box'
drawing.assignMode: 3. Press A or click 'Assign Tracklet ID'
drawing.drawMode: Drawing: Click & drag to create new bounding boxes
drawing.assignModeDesc: Assignment: Click existing boxes to reassign tracklet IDs

ball.title: ‚öΩ Ball Annotation
ball.ballClick: Click precise ball center position to place markers
ball.ballEvent: Select event first, then click ball for event tagging
ball.ballDelete: Right-click ball markers to delete them

editing.title: üìù Event & Detail Editing
editing.selectBox: Click bounding boxes to select them
editing.editDetails: Use 'Edit Details' to set player info (applies to all frames)
editing.eventAnnotation: Select event from dropdown, then click any annotation
editing.eventHotkeys: Use Q,W,E,R,T,Y,U,I,N keys for quick event selection
editing.events: Events apply per frame, details apply to entire tracklet
editing.delete: Use trash icons to delete individual tracklets or all frames

visibility.title: üëÅÔ∏è Visibility & Display Controls
visibility.labelToggle: Toggle tracklet labels and event labels separately
visibility.showAll: Show All / Hide All buttons for bulk visibility control
visibility.ballToggle: Special eye icon for ball annotations (ID 99)

fileManagement.title: üíæ File Management
fileManagement.autoSave: All changes automatically saved to CSV files
fileManagement.csvSupport: Supports standard tracklet annotation CSV format
fileManagement.switchRallies: Use left sidebar to navigate between rally folders
fileManagement.dataPreserved: Original data preserved with automatic backups

visualCues.title: üé® Visual System
visualCues.selectedBoxes: Selected items have thicker borders and glow effects
visualCues.modeIndicator: Current mode shown in top-left corner of canvas
visualCues.zoomLevel: Zoom percentage in bottom-right (click to reset)

quickTips.title: üí° Pro Tips
quickTips.workflow: Efficient workflow: Draw all boxes first, then assign events
quickTips.zoomIn: Zoom in (mouse wheel) for precise annotation placement
quickTips.consistency: Use consistent tracklet IDs across frames for proper tracking
quickTips.ballTracking: Track ball continuously - use event tags for key moments
quickTips.timeline: Use timeline view to check annotation coverage and gaps
quickTips.visibility: Hide completed tracklets to focus on remaining work
quickTips.eventsPerFrame: Events are frame-specific, player details apply globally
quickTips.teamPositioning: Home team plays on the right side of the net, Away team on the left

ball.title: Ball Annotation
ball.modeInstructions: Click on the ball position to annotate. Ball annotations use tracklet ID 99.
ball.helpImport: Import ball annotations from JSON files in the directory
ball.helpAnnotate: Click on ball positions to create point annotations
ball.helpExport: Export ALL annotations (players + ball) to JSON format
ball.instructionImport: Import: Load ball annotations from JSON files
ball.instructionBallMode: Ball Mode: Toggle ball annotation mode OR select tracklet ID 99
ball.instructionClickCanvas: Click Canvas: Once ball mode is active, click to annotate ball positions
ball.instructionDeleteFrame: Delete Frame: Remove ball annotation for current frame
ball.instructionExport: Export: Save ALL annotations to JSON format
ball.instructionYCoordinates: Y-coordinates are automatically corrected for canvas

dialogs.ballAnnotationsExist:
Ball annotations already exist. Do you want to overwrite them with imported data?

This will replace all current ball annotations (tracklet ID 99).

ui.annotationFileFormat: Annotation files should contain data in this format
ui.columnsRequired: At least 7 columns required, up to 12 columns supported. No header required.
ui.frameRangeExample: e.g., 1-10 or 1,3,5 or -20 (start to frame 20) or 200- (frame 200 to end)
ui.selectRallyToStart: Select a rally from the left sidebar to start annotating
ui.eventsApplyCurrentFrame: Events apply to current frame only
ui.selectTrackletToEnable: üí° Select a tracklet ID from the right panel to enable tools
ui.ballAnnotationModeActive: üéØ Ball annotation mode active. Click canvas to place ball markers.
ui.makeSureDirectory: Make sure the directory contains folders with both images and .txt files
ui.chooseDirectory: Choose a directory containing rally folders with annotation data
ui.framesWhereSwitchIds: Frames where tracklets will switch IDs
ui.switchIdsBothTracklets: Note: Will switch IDs for both tracklets in the specified frames, even if only one has annotations
ui.showingAnnotationsSwitch: Showing annotations that will switch IDs ({{count}} annotations)
ui.finalConfirmationSwitch: Final confirmation: Switch IDs for {{count}} annotations?
ui.mergeConfirmationMessage:
This will merge tracklet {{sourceId}} into tracklet {{targetId}}.
{{count}} annotations with ID {{sourceId}} will be changed to ID {{targetId}}.

This action cannot be undone automatically. Continue?
ui.switchConfirmationMessage:
This will switch IDs between tracklet {{id1}} and tracklet {{id2}}.
{{count}} annotations will be affected in {{frames}}.

This action cannot be undone automatically. Continue?

ui.finalSwitchConfirmation: Final confirmation: Switch IDs for {{count}} annotations?
